page.title: 01Middle of Tynron Glen
page.content: Peaceful Tynron Glen with Skinnel water running NW to SE. Highest point torbraehead 400m tributary kirkconnel burn rushes east into the shinnel a landscape of grass, dominated by sheep. Rough pasture and bracken on upper slopes and rounded hilltops. Improved pasture on lower sloes and valley flats, for hay and Silage, some barley and turnips. Field boundaries are Greynacke Dykes many now in disrepair and being steadily replaced by barbed wire. Numberous Hill cattle, and some 20 horses including Strathmilligans driving teams. Good scatter of woodland notably Strathmilligan coniferous wood and ribbon f mixed woodland along shinnel. Population just over 50 mostly centred round two largest farms of Bennan and Auckenbrack. Activity is concerned along the Glen Road with its farm and
